title: Hillary Clinton Talks About Secret Files
summary: Hillary Clinton, a former leader in the U.S., says President Trump's team is hiding files about Jeffrey Epstein, a bad man who hurt people. She wants all the files to come out quickly. The U.S. government released some files but kept others secret to protect people. Hillary and her husband Bill are going to talk to a group in Congress soon. They want their talk to be public so everyone can see it. Some people in Congress accused them of delaying, but Hillary says they have nothing to hide and want fairness for all.

keywords.explanation: a group in the U.S. that makes laws

background_read: Jeffrey Epstein was a man who did bad things to children and adults. The U.S. government has files about his actions. Hillary Clinton and Bill Clinton are important people in U.S. politics who are talking to Congress, a group that helps make laws. Sometimes, files are kept secret to keep people safe or for other reasons.
Article_Structure: WHO: Hillary Clinton, a former U.S. leader, and others like President Trump's team and Congress.
WHAT: Hillary says Trump's team is hiding files about Jeffrey Epstein, and she and Bill will talk to Congress.
WHERE: This happened in Berlin and involves the U.S. government and Congress.
WHY: To get all files released and have fair public talks in Congress.

perspectives.description: She thinks files should be released quickly and talks should be public for fairness.
